snippet: A second day of confrontations between Pakistani police and supporters of Tahir-ul Qadri, a cleric who opposes Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, left at least two people dead and several hundred injured.
abstract: At least two people are killed and more than 100 injured in Pakistan's Punjab Province in clashes between police and supporters of Tahir-ul Qadri, cleric who opposes Prime Min Nawaz Sharif.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and WAQAR GILLANI
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Waqar Gillani from Lahore, Pakistan. Declan Walsh contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: A second day of confrontations between Pakistani police and supporters of Tahir-ul Qadri, a cleric who opposes Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, left at least two people dead and several hundred injured.

headline.main: Deadly Clashes With Police Erupt at Pakistan Protests
headline.print_headline: Deadly Clashes With Police Erupt at Pakistan Protests
